xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric
Class BlockEmpiricalCDFAggregationFunction

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.math.functions.AggregationFunction<Object[],EmpiricalCDF>
      xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.BlockEmpiricalCDFAggregationFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BlockEmpiricalCDFAggregationFunction
extends AggregationFunction<Object[],EmpiricalCDF>

In the context of online aggregation, running aggregates are built. Given an iterator of data, an Aggregator computes iteratively aggregates. For instance, the current maximum of the already processed data is determined. An internal aggregation function processes the computation of the new element by consuming the old aggregate and the new element from the input cursor. Generally, each aggregation function must support a function call of the following type:
agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next).
There, agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f represents the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation.
This class implements an aggregation function that computes empirical estimators. There, the data is processed in blocks of a predefined size. Given such a block of data, an empirical cdf is established.
Consider the following example that displays a concrete application of an empirical cdf aggregation function combined with an aggregator: 

        Aggregator aggregator =
                        new Aggregator(
                                inputCursor(cursor, blockSize), 
                                new BlockEmpiricalCDFAggregationFunction()
                        );

See Also:
Aggregator, AdaptiveAggregationFunction, EmpiricalCDF, Serialized Form

Returns:

invoke

public EmpiricalCDF invoke(EmpiricalCDF old,
                           Object[] next)
Two-figured function call for supporting aggregation by this function. Each aggregation function must support a function call like agg_n = f (agg_n-1, next), where agg_n denotes the computed aggregation value after n steps, f the aggregation function, agg_n-1 the computed aggregation value after n-1 steps and next the next object to use for computation. This method delivers only null as aggregation result as long as the aggregation has not yet initialized. As result of the aggregation a kernel based block estimator, that relies on the current block, is returned.

Specified by:
invoke in class AggregationFunction<Object[],EmpiricalCDF>
Parameters:
old - result of the aggregation function in the previous computation step
next - next object used for computation
Returns:
new kernel based block estimator

main

public static void main(String[] args)
The main method contains some examples to demonstrate the usage and the functionality of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
